definition: to open fire

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
surname Huo

sentences.english: They  fired at a fleeting enemy.
sentences.chinese: 他們向正在逃跑的敵人開火。

sentences.english: Airframe shake for all aircraft when cannon is fired.
sentences.chinese: 所有飛機在機炮開火時，機身會抖動。

sentences.english: Who first fired on the American-Afghan force?
sentences.chinese: 是誰首先向駐阿富汗的美國部隊開火？

sentences.english: The guns belched at the enemy.
Bakiyev has denied ordering troops to fire on protesters.
sentences.chinese: 巴基耶夫已否認命令軍隊向示威者開火。

sentences.english: A gun with a silencer fires once.
sentences.chinese: 一把帶着消音器的槍立即開火了。

sentences.english: The trapped men shot out through the windows at their attackers.
sentences.chinese: 那些被圍困的人從窗戶裏向進攻者開火。

sentences.english: On the Dragon’s stub-wings the 40mm ROCKET LAUNCHERS open up with a BARRAGE of leaping fire which FLASHES down and
sentences.chinese: 飛龍戰機的短翼上，40毫米火箭發射器一齊開火。

sentences.english: She thought that some of them had been laying violent hands on me; and, not daring to attack her master, she turned her vocal artillery against the young scoundrel.
sentences.chinese: 她不敢攻擊她的主人，就向那年輕的惡棍開火了。

sentences.english: Buzzers were later used at all the guns to give the signal for firing.
sentences.chinese: 後來就給各炮安裝下達開火令的響鈴。

sentences.english: The angry Stuyvesant went to Fort Amsterdam and prepared to open fire on the British.
sentences.chinese: 憤怒的司徒維桑特走到阿姆斯特丹堡準備向英方開火。

sentences.english: They were firing large guns at the green warriors.
sentences.chinese: 他們正在用巨大的槍朝綠色的武士們開火。

sentences.english: The troops opened fire on workers and killed dozens.
sentences.chinese: 軍隊在工人上開火，四死傷無數。

sentences.english: Synchro Cannons on line and ready to fire.
sentences.chinese: 同步炮連接能源，準備開火。

sentences.english: We shot them out of their hiding places.
sentences.chinese: 隱蔽的地方開火逼他們走出來。

sentences.english: Bahraini security forces later opened fire on the funeral proceedings.
sentences.chinese: 隨後，巴林警方在葬禮上開火。

definition: frying pan
steamer
to ignite/to light a fire/to agitate/to start an engine/ignition/fig. to stir up trouble
war situation
fuse (for explosives)/(fig.) proximate cause/the last straw
out of order (of machine)/not working properly/a failing (of a system)
to open fire/to shoot a gun
to count/reckoning
to withdraw from/to evacuate
see 鍋|锅[guo1]/see 涮鍋子|涮锅子[shuan4 guo1 zi5]/bowl (of a smoking pipe etc)
to spar/to fight/to duke it out
(of a sports competition or match) to commence/(of a war or battle) to break out/to perform acrobatic or choreographed fighting (in Chinese opera)/to brawl/to come to blows
to turn white-hot/to intensify/to reach a climax
to heat water/to boil water
frightening words to scare people (idiom); alarmist talk/reds under the beds
several hours
